intro: Justicia arvensis, commonly known as Common False Dragonhead, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Botanically, it belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure and medicinal properties.
